name: St. Chrodegang of Metz

locations.description: Bishop of Metz and reformer of the Frankish Church

summary: Chrodegang was the Bishop of Metz from 742 to 766. He was a key figure in the reform of the Frankish Church and a close advisor to Pepin the Short. He introduced the Roman liturgy and chant to his diocese and established the Rule of Chrodegang, which regulated the common life of canons. He founded the Abbey of Gorze and played an important role in the Carolingian Renaissance.
